title: Default Quarkus application generated by maven plugin with security-webauthn extension doesn't compile

labels.name: triage/duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus: `2.13.3.Final`

The Default Quarkus application generated by Maven plugin with `security-webauthn` extension is throwing an exception on compile time.

Stacktrace
```
[ERROR] [1] Unsatisfied dependency for type io.quarkus.security.webauthn.WebAuthnUserProvider and qualifiers [@Default]
[ERROR]     - java member: io.quarkus.security.webauthn.WebAuthnTrustedIdentityProvider#userProvider
[ERROR]     - declared on CLASS bean [types=[io.quarkus.security.identity.IdentityProvider<io.quarkus.security.identity.request.TrustedAuthenticationRequest>, io.quarkus.security.webauthn.WebAuthnTrustedIdentityProvider, java.lang.Object], qualifiers=[@Default, @Any], target=io.quarkus.security.webauthn.WebAuthnTrustedIdentityProvider]
```

### Expected behavior

Quarkus application that actually works.

### Actual behavior

Quarkus app doesn't compile

### How to Reproduce?

```
mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.13.3.Final:create\
    -DprojectGroupId=org.acme\
    -DprojectArtifactId=config-quickstart\
    -Dextensions='security-webauthn'\
    -DnoCode
```

`mvn clean install`
